The 1972 Shaw Brothers kung fu film The Deadly Knives lives up to its name with plenty of body-impaling, flying-knife action. Also known as Fists of Vengeance, the film is helmed by Korean director Chang Yi Hu, who directed a handful of genre-arching films for the Shaw Brothers during the 1960s and 70s including period actioner The Thunderbolt Fist (1972) and supernatural romance Night of the Devil's Bride (1975).
 The Deadly Knives stars martial artist Ling Yun (Six Assassins, The Iron Buddha), starlet Lily Li (The Wandering Swordsman), and father-daughter duo Ching Miao (Heads for Sale) and Ching Li (Blood Brothers).   Plotting to obtain the Yen family's land, dastardly Japanese plutocrat Omura (Ching Miao) bribes Yen nephew Hsu Chien (Chen Feng Chen) to steal the family seal and land deed. When Hsu Chien is caught in the act, he viciously beats elderly Master Yen to death to cover his actions.
 Determined to avenge the wrongs committed on his family and his country, young master Yen Tzu Fei (Ling Yun) blazes a knife-throwing path of revenge that leads him to his love Yue Hua's (Ching Li) father, who has corrupt connections with the Japanese.
